triana.types.util

Class Triplet

  • java.lang.Object
    • triana.types.util.Triplet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Triplet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Triplet is an Object containing three numbers that can generate a uniform sequence of numbers, which can be used to represent an array index or an independent variable in, say, graphical applications. The elements of Triplet are numbers giving the integer length of the sequence and the doubles start and step of the sequence. Various methods are provided for creating and reading Triplets and converting them to equivalent arrays of numbers.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Triplet()
      Constructs an empty Triplet.
      Triplet(double[] array)
      Constructs a Triplet from an array of doubles that should contain a uniformly spaced set of values.
      Triplet(int l)
      Constructs a Triplet with the specified length and default values of start (0) and step (1).
      Triplet(int l, double st)
      Constructs a Triplet with the specified length and starting value, and with a default value of the step (1).
      Triplet(int l, double st, double sp)
      Constructs a Triplet with the specified length, start, and step.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Triplet

        public Triplet()
        Constructs an empty Triplet. capacity and the specified capacityIncrement.

      • Triplet

        public Triplet(int l,
       double st,
       double sp)
        Constructs a Triplet with the specified length, start, and step.
        Parameters:
        l - The number of elements in the uniformly spaced set.
        st - The first value of the set.
        sp - The interval (uniform) between values in the set.

      • Triplet

        public Triplet(int l)
        Constructs a Triplet with the specified length and default values of start (0) and step (1).
        Parameters:
        l - The number of elements in the uniformly spaced set.

      • Triplet

        public Triplet(int l,
       double st)
        Constructs a Triplet with the specified length and starting value, and with a default value of the step (1).
        Parameters:
        l - The number of elements in the uniformly spaced set.
        st - The first value of the set.

      • Triplet

        public Triplet(double[] array)
        Constructs a Triplet from an array of doubles that should contain a uniformly spaced set of values. Users are responsible for testing the array using method testUniform, below.

      • testUniform

        public static boolean testUniform(double[] values)
        Class method that tests a one-dimensional array to see if it is uniform and can therefore be converted to a Triplet. TODO - ADDED BY ANDREW 12.08.10 - have I broken this?

      • convertToTriplet

        public static Triplet convertToTriplet(double[] values)
        Class method that converts a uniformly spaced one-dimensional array of doubles to a Triplet. This does not test whether the array is uniform: use method testUniform to do that. It just uses the first values and length of the array to generate the Triplet.

      • toAString

        public final java.lang.String toAString()
        Returns:
        a string representation of this Triplet in the form :-
        el0 el1 el2 \n

      • toAColumn

        public final java.lang.String toAColumn()
        Returns:
        a string representation of this Triplet in the form :-
        el0 \n el1 \n el2 \n
